body.description: Whether you're looking for a place to get some work done or really just need another surface for your colossal penny collection, this desk from the Carson Forge collection is perfect for you. It features three drawers that glide on smooth metal runners – each provides versatile storage. The lower drawer holds letter-size hanging files to help get you organized. Finished in a rustic Washington Cherry finish and accented with wrought iron style hardware, this desk hard is to take your eyes off of.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Whether you’re looking for a place to get some work done or really just need another surface for your colossal penny collection, this desk from the Carson Forge collection is perfect for you. This home office desk features three drawers that glide on smooth metal runners – each provides versatile storage for pens, pencils, notebooks, binders and more. The lower drawer holds letter-size hanging files to help keep your most important files organized and easy to find. The spacious top surface of this desk with storage is large enough for a computer, lamp, your planner, and more. Finished in a rustic Washington Cherry and accented with wrought iron style hardware, this desk hard is to take your eyes off of. We hope you like what you see. Sauder designers travel the world and bring back the best and latest in style, finish, and color trends. This inspiring world travel is evident in the cutting edge and innovative furniture solutions we offer to you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The assembled desk is very sturdy and attractive. However, I wouldn't agree that it's necessarily easy to assemble. I hired a couple of savvy gals to put it together and it took them at least two hours. Then one leg had to be replaced since the package included the wrong leg. Fortunately the finished desk was worth the money and effort.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Never disappointed with Sauder products!!!
reviews.reviewText: We are so impressed by the detailed instructions and the complete, organized packaging of all the pieces in order to be able to put this desk together. Not going to lie. It took my husband and I tag teaming maybe five hours (did it over two half days) to complete. There were times we thought something wasn't right or was missing, but every time we looked a little harder we found the answer or part. We feel we really accomplished something here haha. The end product is beautiful. My husband hadn't seen what I ordered but said I picked a good one! It's my new desk and I'm very pleased. It's solid and attractive!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value, exceeds expectations.
reviews.reviewText: I'm very happy with my new desk! It provides me with what I wanted: a broad work surface that's much like working on a table top, and plenty of storage so I can tuck all my supplies away. There's enough space to work with multiple books, a notepad and desk lamp, with my macbook and my drink at opposite ends, for the sake of safety.The pictures in the listing don't do it justice. t's not made of solid wood, but for the price, it's more than reasonably sturdy. Once assembled it doesn't feel wobbly or suspect. It's not solid wood, but it's quite heavy and very handsome. I haven't had any problem with the drawers being wobbly or not gliding smoothly. The screws which set up the slides are easily accessible, so they can be adjusted if need be. NB: the pencil drawer is just that, it's for pencils and notepads, it's not the place to store your collection of coins and lead figurines. Conveniently, the max load for each drawer is listed in the book.Assembling the desk did take several hours, working alone. If you can follow instructions and interpret pictures, it's not too taxing. The drawers were the most complicated bit, but once you do the first, the rest work the same way. I didn't have any missing or damaged pieces. One corner has a tiny chip in the veneer, but it's most likely I'm responsible for it and a touch of scratch pencil will fix it right up.Yes, the hardware comes all jumbled together. I sorted the pieces out in an ice cube tray before I started, to make I had them all (there were extras) and to make it easy to find what I needed as I worked. Not every piece is labeled with a sticker - some had the letter printed on the edges. The others were pretty obvious, and if you still can't figure it out, there's a visual guide in the instruction book. It was easier to put together than some of my Ikea pieces because it has text, not just pictures. The box it comes in is very heavy; most people will need a second person to get it in the house. The weight of the box was impressive. You shouldn't try to turn the desk upright on your own either - it won't work and you'll risk damaging it. There are no holes in the desk for cords. The back of the desk isn't as attractive as it could be (behind the drawers on the right is particleboard), so it's not the best choice to place in the middle of a space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality desk at a great value.
reviews.reviewText: I paid $211 before tax to buy this desk as an early Xmas present for my wife: the desk is beautiful, my wife loves it, and I consider the price more than fair. It's heavy, of course, slightly over 100 lbs, and the assembly appeared daunting enough ( a lot of hardware) that I paid someone $50 to do it. Daniel works on houses for a living and it took him just over 2 hours to assemble the desk - which means it would take most people an entire day (he's very fast). Here's a tip I discovered when I was still considering doing it myself. Most, or all of the larger, darker pieces have stickers on them, part A, B, C, etc. However, on the smaller, lighter-colored pieces I didn't see any stickers, so I was thinking all the pieces weren't marked. Upon closer inspection, however, I noticed the letter and number were lightly carved into them. It's fairly small; you have to look close. Which brings me to the part I was most impressed with. Customer service. Part D37 was broken on arrival. I had Daniel use it anyway, but I called customer service to ask for that piece in case mine didn't hold up. I can't remember if there was an automated system, but if there was it was short and to the point - not the type that makes me want to fling the phone through the window. I do remember that it took almost no time before I was speaking to this really nice lady named Abby who apologized for the inconvenience, asked for the minimum order details, and said the piece would be in the mail by the next morning at the latest. The whole phone call took 2-3 minutes, and the piece was in my hand in about 5 days. You don't see customer service like that anymore! At least I don't. Thank you, Abby. Thank you, Sauder. I came away impressed by your company.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good product. Looks great although it is not wood ...
reviews.reviewText: Very good product. Looks great although it is not wood but you pay for it accordingly. The assembly takes time but the manual is very clear.

Very strong desk! Heavy! It does take a while to put together and there were a few tiny chips on the top of the desk. Not crazy about the finish either because it looks a little fake but overall it’s nice. It’s pretty thick would and not difficult to assemble, just takes some time.

This is a sturdy, nice appearing desk if properly assembled. It is heavy and takes many hours to assemble even if you are experienced with similar items. The directions could be better, though all of the information you need is there if you search for it.

reviews.reviewTitle: For furniture piece that fits in an 8 inch thick box I couldn't be happier with it
reviews.reviewText: IMPRESSED. For furniture piece that fits in an 8 inch thick box I couldn't be happier with it. I usually make my own furniture but sometimes I buy pieces like this and this is the best brand for furniture in a box. This desk could actually be moved from one house to the next and not fall apart during the move. The instructions were awesome. Actually written by a person who speaks English and has assembled it enough times so they included the right details so you can put it together right the first time. Assume this will take a while to put together. Assume at a relaxed pace 3 to 4 hours for the first one. If you are quite proficient, 2 hours.As to the look of the desk, it looks great. As to the function of the drawers, great and adjustable. But they do require tuning so everything works and fits together smoothly.Shipping with prime, 2 days.

I use it for my many administrative needs that are a normal part of home life. I am a very good handyman and have constructed many things in my day including building a house. This was a good product to assemble but one needed to pay very careful attention to the assembly. It was somewhat tricky in parts. Dont tackle it unless you are very good with tools.
